attributes.action: Stop the London-wide extention of the ULEZ in 2023.
attributes.additional_details:
Sadiq Khan should not be implementing an unpopular policy that the public would have NEVER voted for. Given a proper consultation, which gives the public the chance to FULLY opose this measure, the public would reject this proposal during the consultation.
The government and/or Parliament need to step in now and act on the interests of the large majority of the public.
attributes.background: Stop Sadiq Khan from implementing this plan. We were not informed of this during the 2021 election, and there are many of Londons residents who are totally against this further expansion. Parliament must act now to block this from happening.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. It is the responsibility of the Mayor of London and the London Assembly.

The London Assembly has its own petitions process. You can find out more about how to petition the London Assembly here: https://www.london.gov.uk/about-us/london-assembly/petitions

We have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Revoke local government powers to charge CAZ, LEZ, and ULEZ: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/599985
